auditorium

Class HostPointer

  • java.lang.Object
    • auditorium.HostPointer

  • public class HostPointer
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class simply wraps an ID, IP and port together. This class represents a data structure in the auditorium format.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HostPointer

        public HostPointer(java.lang.String nodeid,
           java.lang.String ip,
           int port)
        Parameters:
        nodeid - This is the id of the host.
        ip - This is the IP of the host in dotted decimal format.
        port - This is the port that the host is listening on.

      • HostPointer

        public HostPointer(ASExpression hostexp)
            throws IncorrectFormatException
        Construct a new host address from its s-expression representation.
        Parameters:
        hostexp - This should be of the format (host [id] [ip] [port])
        Throws:
        IncorrectFormatException - This method throws if the given exp is not correctly formatted.

        Return the sexpression representation of this host pointer.
